The photographs used in the collage imag: 19. They were repurposed pictures showing different types of medical afflictions on patients' faces.
The first photograph in the collage was: showing a 12-year-old who allegedly had an allergic reaction to wearing a mask for several days while on vacation.
The second photograph in the collage: taken from Getty Images, showed a child with varicella (chickenpox), unrelated to staph infections.
The third photograph: from The Royal Children's Hospital Melbourne website, depicted a child with eczema herpeticum, an infection caused by the herpes simplex 1 virus, not staph infections.
